channel.title: News | Ding Group at the Tufts University

item.title: Our paper on using potential contrasting to optimize force fields with experimental data is published on J. Phys. Chem. B.
item.description: Checkout the final version “Optimizing Force Fields with Experimental Data Using Ensemble Reweighting and Potential Contrasting”

item.title: Welcome to Kun Yue, John Drohan, and Saki Doi!
item.description: Kun joins the lab as the lab’s first postdoc. Both John and Saki join the lab as summer interns. Welcome on board!

item.title: The second manuscript from the Ding lab is online!
item.description: Checkout the preprint of the manuscript titled “Optimizing Force Fields with Experimental Data Using Ensemble Reweighting and Potential Contrasting”

item.title: Our paper on BayesMBAR is published on J. Chem. Theory Comput.
item.description: Checkout the final version of the paper at “Bayesian Multistate Bennett Acceptance Ratio Methods”

item.title: Welcome Ryan Cooley to the group as an undergraduate researcher!
Welcome to Christine Wong and Sophia Gerogiannis!
item.description: Christine and Sophia will join the group as undergraduate researchers in Spring 2024! Welcome!

item.title: Congratulations on the first manuscript from the Ding lab!
item.description: Checkout the preprint of the manuscript titled “Bayesian Multistate Bennett Acceptance Ratio Methods”

item.title: Welcome Khoa to the group!
item.description: Khoa is a freshman at Tufts! He is interested in both chemistry and computer science.

item.title: The Ding lab will officially open in the Department of Chemistry at Tufts on August 16th!
